title: Authors and Citation
text: Collin Edwards. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Edwards C (2026). xldiff: Compare excel sheets. R package version 0.2.0, https://framverse.r-universe.dev/xldiff.
code: @Manual{,   title = {xldiff: Compare excel sheets},   author = {Collin Edwards},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://framverse.r-universe.dev/xldiff}, }

title: Compare excel sheets
text: goal xldiff facilitate comparing excel sheets look changes, inspired diff tools. xldiff originally developed help compare inputs outputs different runs FRAM salmon model, stores inputs outputs excel files. However, comparison tools can used broadly compare different files structure, example monthly reports summarizing survey information, service use, finances. xldiff part FRAMverse R-Universe

title: Compare excel sheets
text: can install development version xldiff R-Universe like : Rtools remotes pak installed, can install source code like :
code: install.packages("xldiff", repos = "https://framverse.r-universe.dev") remotes::install_github("cbedwards-dfw/xldiff") #OR # pak::pkg_install("cbedwards-dfw/xldiff")

title: Compare excel sheets
text: can carry simple comparisons excel files excel_diff() function. begin , must two excel sheets generally similar, cells differing values. walk example, first must create two excel sheets. use first 20 rows penguins data palmerpenguins package (https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/).
code: library(palmerpenguins) library(writexl)  # create our two data frames dat1 = dat2 = penguins[1:20,] ## convert $island to character for easier modification dat1$island = dat2$island = as.character(dat1$island) ## change several entries in dat2. dat2$island[10] = "Scotland" dat2$body_mass_g[6] = 365 dat2$bill_depth_mm[20] = 25    ## write to excel files, in sheet named "penguins". See ?writexl::writexlsx. write_xlsx(list(penguins = dat1),            path = "example-penguins-1.xlsx") write_xlsx(list(penguins = dat2),            path = "example-penguins-2.xlsx")

title: Compare excel sheets
text: two files hand, can use excel_diff compare . need specify two files comparing, name new file show comparison, sheet comparing. produces excel file shows highlights changes cells.  can also run diff displays “Viewer” section Rstudio using excel_diff_table():
code: library(xldiff)  excel_diff(file_1 = "example-penguins-1.xlsx",           file_2 = "example-penguins-2.xlsx",           results_name = "penguin-file-comparison.xlsx",           sheet_name = "penguins" ) excel_diff(file_1 = "example-penguins-1.xlsx",           file_2 = "example-penguins-2.xlsx",           sheet_name = "penguins" )

what: Adds cell borders to openxlsx spreadsheet — add_cell_borders
title: Adds cell borders to openxlsx spreadsheet — add_cell_borders
text: Update: excel_diff now includes formatting! function hopefully less necessary.

title: Adds cell borders to openxlsx spreadsheet — add_cell_borders
code: add_cell_borders(   wb,   sheet,   block_ranges,   sheet_start = "A1",   every_cell = FALSE,   border_col = "black",   border_thickness = "medium" )

title: Adds cell borders to openxlsx spreadsheet — add_cell_borders
text: wb openxlsx workbook object sheet character corresponding sheet name openxlsx workbook object wb. block_ranges One cell ranges specified excel format (e.g. c("A1:D5, "B6", "A8:D8")) sheet_start Optional. wb$sheet corresponds excel sheet wb$sheet entries read starting cell "A1" (e.g. readxl::read_excel range specified skip provided), provide top left cell read R order handle offsetting, can specify cell ranges based original excel file. every_cell want borders around individual cell cell block (TRUE), just around outer edges block (FALSE). Defaults FALSE. border_col Color border. See ?openxlsx::createStyle details. Defaults "black". border_thickness Thickness border. See ?openxlsx::createStyle details. Common choices: "thin", "thick".

title: Adds cell borders to openxlsx spreadsheet — add_cell_borders
text: calling sheet_diff(), creating new workbook diff contents, coloring highlight changed cells, original spreadsheet formatting lost. facilitate interpretting diff, can useful recreate major components original formatting, especially cell borders. function adds cell borders, designed ease use replicating formatting original excel file. Blocks cells give borders can specified original excel format (e.g. "A1:D5"). outside borders around block (default), use argument every_cell = FALSE. add cell borders within block generate grid appearance, set every_cell = TRUE. Note non-border formatting cell maintained, border formatting overwritten. adding thin boundaries inner cells thick outer border block cells, first use add_cell_borders every_cell = TRUE, appropriate border arguments (usually border_thickness = "thin") use every_cell = FALSE appropriate border arguments (usually border_thickness = "medium").

what: Format openxlsx2 worksheet based on changes — add_changed_formats
title: Format openxlsx2 worksheet based on changes — add_changed_formats
text: Highlights cells changed, coloring differently increasing, decreasing, non-numeric cells. Typically used worksheet contains $sheet.diff dataframe sheet comparison provided cur_sheet argument. cases may useful define custom color schemes (e.g., increasing numbers good decreasing numbers bad, may want green red foregrounds types changes). Individual colors can provided increasing, decreasing, text changes. Similarly, increasing profits decreasing costs logically show color. Optional arguments rows_invert, cols_invert, df_invert allow specify individual regions dataframe reverse color scheme.

title: Format openxlsx2 worksheet based on changes — add_changed_formats
code: add_changed_formats(   wb,   cur_sheet,   sheet_comp,   rows_invert = NULL,   cols_invert = NULL,   df_invert = NULL,   change_color = "#E1C0FF",   pos_color = "#FFC7CE",   neg_color = "#C6EFCE" )

title: Format openxlsx2 worksheet based on changes — add_changed_formats
text: wb openxlsx2 workbook make make changes. cur_sheet sheet name openxlsx2 workbook make changes. sheet_comp list comparison dataframes generated sheet_comp() rows_invert Optional vector row numbers invert color scheme increase vs decrease. cols_invert Optional vector column numbers invert color scheme increase vs decrease. df_invert Optional data frame $row $col entries identify individual cells invert color schemes increase vs decrease. Defaults NULL. change_color Hex code color highlight cells changed (numerics). Defaults lavendar ("#E1C0FF"). pos_color change_color, numeric cells increase value. Defaults coral ("#E1C0FF"). neg_color change_color, numeric cells decrease value. Defaults light green ("#C6EFCE")

what: Translates from excel cell address to rows and columns — cell_range_translate
title: Translates from excel cell address to rows and columns — cell_range_translate
text: Translates excel cell address rows columns

title: Translates from excel cell address to rows and columns — cell_range_translate
code: cell_range_translate(x, expand = TRUE, start = "A1")

title: Translates from excel cell address to rows and columns — cell_range_translate
text: x Single string individual cell cell range (e.g. "D6" "D6:AC8") expand TRUE (default), provides row column cells range. False, provides just row column start end cells. start Optional argument account offset matching cells excel file dataframe dataframe generated reading excel file starting location "A1".

title: Translates from excel cell address to rows and columns — cell_range_translate
text: dataframe addresses cell range, $row gives row number $col gives column number.

title: Translates from excel cell address to rows and columns — cell_range_translate

what: Apply style to worksheet based on one or more excel-style cell ranges — cells_stylize
title: Apply style to worksheet based on one or more excel-style cell ranges — cells_stylize
text: Apply style worksheet based one excel-style cell ranges

title: Apply style to worksheet based on one or more excel-style cell ranges — cells_stylize
code: cells_stylize(wb, sheet, style, block_ranges, stack = TRUE)

title: Apply style to worksheet based on one or more excel-style cell ranges — cells_stylize
text: wb openxlsx workbook object sheet character corresponding sheet name openxlsx workbook object wb. style openxlsx cell style, created openxlsx::createStyle(). can include text size, bolding italics, text wrapping, foreground color, text color, etc. See ?openxlsx::createStyle details. block_ranges One cell ranges specified excel format (e.g. c("A1:D5, "B6", "A8:D8")) stack style appended existing styles (TRUE) replace existing styles (FALSE). Defaults TRUE.

what: Compares two dataframes and returns diff as flextable — diff_to_table
title: Compares two dataframes and returns diff as flextable — diff_to_table
text: Workhorse function excel_diff_table(). Can used diff pair dataframes tibbles. Diff applied cell cell, results meaningful shape two objects .

title: Compares two dataframes and returns diff as flextable — diff_to_table
code: diff_to_table(   df1,   df2,   proportional_threshold = 0.001,   absolute_threshold = NULL,   digits_show = 6,   dfnames = NULL,   excelify_col_names = FALSE )

title: Compares two dataframes and returns diff as flextable — diff_to_table
text: df1 first dataframe tibble df2 second dataframe tibble proportional_threshold Sets threshold proportional change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 10% flagged changed. proportional_threshold override value behavior provided. Numeric, defaults 0.001 (0.1% change). absolute_threshold Optional. Sets threshold absolute change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 0.1 flagged changed. provided, override proportional_threshold. Numeric, defaults NULL. digits_show change number values, many digits shown ## ---> ##? Numeric, defaults 6. Recommend making small flagged changes get printed (e.g., 2 proportional_threshold 0.001, 0.1% changes get flagged, first two digits get shown). dfnames Character vector names two dataframes use table title. Optional. excelify_col_names columns identified excel letter convention? Defaults FALSE. Set TRUE comparing dataframes extracted excel sheets.

title: Compares two dataframes and returns diff as flextable — diff_to_table
text: flextable object

title: Compares two dataframes and returns diff as flextable — diff_to_table
text: Diff table ROW mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs gear carb 2 21 6 160 110 3.9 2.875 17.02 0 1 4 4 2 21 -8 160 110 3.9 2.875 17.02 0 1 4 4
code: df1 <- mtcars df2 <- mtcars df2[2, 2] <- -8 df2[5, c(3, 4)] <- c(11, 15) diff_to_table(df1, df2) .cl-4d362fcc{}.cl-4d2de8a8{font-family:'DejaVu title: Minimal spreadsheet comparison function — excel_diff
text: Compares single sheet two files, creating new file uses formatting existing sheets (except highlighting) highlights cells differed. Small numeric differences cell values can result happenstance ("decimal dust") - digits_signif proportional.diff arguments can control behavior ignore minor numeric differences.

title: Minimal spreadsheet comparison function — excel_diff
code: excel_diff(   file_1,   file_2,   results_name,   sheet_name,   sheet_name_file_2 = NULL,   proportional_threshold = 0.001,   absolute_threshold = NULL,   digits_show = 6,   verbose = FALSE,   extra_width = NULL )

title: Minimal spreadsheet comparison function — excel_diff
text: file_1 Filename (including path) first file compare file_2 Filename (including path) second file compare results_name Name (including path) file save comparison . Must end ".xlsx" sheet_name Character string sheet compare. Can provide vector character strings produce comparisons multiple sheets. sheet_name_file_2 OPTIONAL. Matching sheet names sheet_name file 2. Use two files matching sheets different names. Defaults NULL. proportional_threshold Sets threshold proportional change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 10% flagged changed. proportional_threshold override value behavior provided. Numeric, defaults 0.001 (0.1% change). absolute_threshold Optional. Sets threshold absolute change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 0.1 flagged changed. provided, override proportional_threshold. Numeric, defaults NULL. digits_show change number values, many digits shown ## ---> ##? Numeric, defaults 6. Recommend making small flagged changes get printed (e.g., 2 proportional_threshold 0.001, 0.1% changes get flagged, first two digits get shown). verbose sheet names listed diffed? Logical, defaults TRUE extra_width much extra width added columns changed? Helpful improve readability, since changed cells longer entries. Numeric, defaults 0.4.

title: Minimal spreadsheet comparison function — excel_diff
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ filename_1 <- "Chin1124.xlsx" filename_2 <- "Chin2524.xlsx"  excel_diff(   file_1 = filename_1,   file_2 = filename_2,   results.name = "Chin1124 vs Chin 2524.xlsx",   sheet_name = "ER_ESC_Overview_New" ) } # }

what: Diff excel sheets and show table — excel_diff_table
title: Diff excel sheets and show table — excel_diff_table
text: Similar excel_diff, returns flextable can displayed navigated Rstudio viewer. shows rows changed. every row changes, provides row , highlighting changed vlaues (red value file_1, green value file_2)."ROWS" column identifies excel row number columns identify excel column names. Defaults flagging changes least 0.1% file_1 file_2 (proportional.diff = TRUE, digits.signif = 3).

title: Diff excel sheets and show table — excel_diff_table
code: excel_diff_table(   file_1,   file_2,   sheet_name,   proportional_threshold = 0.001,   absolute_threshold = NULL,   digits_show = 6 )

title: Diff excel sheets and show table — excel_diff_table
text: file_1 Filename (including path) first file compare file_2 Filename (including path) second file compare sheet_name Character string single excel sheet compare files. (Unlike excel_diff, one sheet can compared time) proportional_threshold Sets threshold proportional change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 10% flagged changed. proportional_threshold override value behavior provided. Numeric, defaults 0.001 (0.1% change). absolute_threshold Optional. Sets threshold absolute change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 0.1 flagged changed. provided, override proportional_threshold. Numeric, defaults NULL. digits_show change number values, many digits shown ## ---> ##? Numeric, defaults 6. Recommend making small flagged changes get printed (e.g., 2 proportional_threshold 0.001, 0.1% changes get flagged, first two digits get shown).

title: Diff excel sheets and show table — excel_diff_table
text: flextable object.

title: Diff excel sheets and show table — excel_diff_table
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ excel_diff_table(   file_1 = "C:/Repos/test file 1.xlsx",   file_2 = "C:/Repos/test file 2.xlsx",   sheet = "Sheet1" ) } # }

what: Diff excel sheet and return tibble — excel_diff_tibble
title: Diff excel sheet and return tibble — excel_diff_tibble
text: Compares sheet two excel files returns tibble diff.

title: Diff excel sheet and return tibble — excel_diff_tibble
code: excel_diff_tibble(   file_1,   file_2,   sheet_name,   proportional_threshold = 0.001,   absolute_threshold = NULL,   digits_show = 6,   trim_cols = FALSE,   diff_only = FALSE )

title: Diff excel sheet and return tibble — excel_diff_tibble
text: file_1 Filename (including path) first file compare file_2 Filename (including path) second file compare sheet_name Character string single excel sheet compare files. (Unlike excel_diff, one sheet can compared time) proportional_threshold Sets threshold proportional change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 10% flagged changed. proportional_threshold override value behavior provided. Numeric, defaults 0.001 (0.1% change). absolute_threshold Optional. Sets threshold absolute change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 0.1 flagged changed. provided, override proportional_threshold. Numeric, defaults NULL. digits_show change number values, many digits shown ## ---> ##? Numeric, defaults 6. Recommend making small flagged changes get printed (e.g., 2 proportional_threshold 0.001, 0.1% changes get flagged, first two digits get shown). trim_cols Remove unchanged columns? Useful wide dataframes viewing results console. Defaults FALSE. diff_only Show changed values? defaults FALSE.

what: Compare two sheets to see if formula use changed — formula_diff
title: Compare two sheets to see if formula use changed — formula_diff
text: Identifies one cells changed formula two excel sheets.

title: Compare two sheets to see if formula use changed — formula_diff
code: formula_diff(file_1, file_2, sheet_name)

title: Compare two sheets to see if formula use changed — formula_diff
text: file_1 Filename (including path) first file compare file_2 Filename (including path) second file compare sheet_name Character string sheet compare. Can provide vector character strings produce comparisons multiple sheets.

title: Compare two sheets to see if formula use changed — formula_diff
text: invisibly returns dataframe cell address /formulas cases formula present files differed.

title: Compare two sheets to see if formula use changed — formula_diff
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ formula_diff(   file_1 = "CohoPugetSoundTAMMInputTemplate2025.xlsx",   file_2 = "CohoPugetSoundTAMMInputs 2025 v1.5.xlsx",   sheet_name = "Input_Harvestnew" ) } # }

what: Provide Excel addresses from matrix of logicals — mat_to_a1
title: Provide Excel addresses from matrix of logicals — mat_to_a1
text: Useful working functions need excel formats (e.g. openxlsx2 functions). try simplify blocks TRUEs block addresses.

title: Provide Excel addresses from matrix of logicals — mat_to_a1
code: mat_to_a1(mat)

title: Provide Excel addresses from matrix of logicals — mat_to_a1
text: mat matrix logical values

title: Provide Excel addresses from matrix of logicals — mat_to_a1
text: vector characters containing addresses excel "A1" format.

title: Provide Excel addresses from matrix of logicals — mat_to_a1
code: mat <- matrix(FALSE, ncol = 4, nrow = 3) mat[1, 1] <- TRUE mat[2, 3] <- TRUE mat #>       [,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4] #> [1,]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE #> [2,] FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE #> [3,] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE mat_to_a1(mat) #> [1] "A1" "C2"

what: Summarize the rows changed between two dataframes — present_rows_changed
title: Summarize the rows changed between two dataframes — present_rows_changed
text: given two dataframes, uses sheet_comp compare two dataframes, presents rows changed: prints row numbers console, returns "diff" rows. Optionally, can ignore columns changed can show changed values.

title: Summarize the rows changed between two dataframes — present_rows_changed
code: present_rows_changed(   t1,   t2,   proportional_threshold = 0.001,   absolute_threshold = NULL,   digits_show = 6,   trim_cols = FALSE,   diff_only = FALSE )

title: Summarize the rows changed between two dataframes — present_rows_changed
text: t1 First dataframe t2 Second dataframe, dimensions first. proportional_threshold Sets threshold proportional change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 10% flagged changed. proportional_threshold override value behavior provided. Numeric, defaults 0.001 (0.1% change). absolute_threshold Optional. Sets threshold absolute change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 0.1 flagged changed. provided, override proportional_threshold. Numeric, defaults NULL. digits_show change number values, many digits shown ## ---> ##? Numeric, defaults 6. Recommend making small flagged changes get printed (e.g., 2 proportional_threshold 0.001, 0.1% changes get flagged, first two digits get shown). trim_cols Remove unchanged columns? Useful wide dataframes viewing results console. Defaults FALSE. diff_only Show changed values? defaults FALSE.

title: Summarize the rows changed between two dataframes — present_rows_changed
text: diff two dataframes, similar $sheet_diff part return sheet_comp. Includes row_number column, remaining columns labeled match excel column naming conventions.

title: Summarize the rows changed between two dataframes — present_rows_changed
text: Alternatively, look diffdf package!

what: Compare two dataframes of spreadsheets — sheet_comp
title: Compare two dataframes of spreadsheets — sheet_comp
text: Primary funtion xldiff package. cell values change dataframe t1 dataframe t2, corresponding $sheet_diff entry show [first value] -->  [second value]. Note changes presenting characters, changes numbers many digits can produce difficult--read cells. proportional_threshold (optionally absolute_threshold) can used determine big change flagged. digits_show controls many significant digits used showing diffs. example, proportional_threshold = 0.01 digits_show = 5 flag changes least 1%, changes present, flagged cell simplify numbers 5 significant digits showing ## -> ##.

title: Compare two dataframes of spreadsheets — sheet_comp
code: sheet_comp(   t1,   t2,   proportional_threshold = 0.001,   absolute_threshold = NULL,   digits_show = 6 )

title: Compare two dataframes of spreadsheets — sheet_comp
text: t1 First dataframe t2 Second dataframe, dimensions first. proportional_threshold Sets threshold proportional change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 10% flagged changed. proportional_threshold override value behavior provided. Numeric, defaults 0.001 (0.1% change). absolute_threshold Optional. Sets threshold absolute change differences ignored. example, value 0.1 means changes less 0.1 flagged changed. provided, override proportional_threshold. Numeric, defaults NULL. digits_show change number values, many digits shown ## ---> ##? Numeric, defaults 6. Recommend making small flagged changes get printed (e.g., 2 proportional_threshold 0.001, 0.1% changes get flagged, first two digits get shown).

title: Compare two dataframes of spreadsheets — sheet_comp
text: List comparison data frames, including logical matrices used formatting cells highlight changes. $sheet_diff: cell entries comparison $mat_changed logical matrix TRUE corresponds cell changed $mat_diff_decrease: logical matrix TRUE corresponds cell numeric values decreased = mat_diff_increase: , increases.

title: Compare two dataframes of spreadsheets — sheet_comp
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## using palmerpenguins data to simulate spreadsheets library(palmerpenguins) t1 <- t2 <- head(penguins) ## change island variable to characters for easier modification t2$island <- t1$island <- as.character(t1$island) ## change several entries in the second version t2$island[3] <- "Scotland" t2$flipper_length_mm[1] <- 18 sheet_comp(t1, t2) } # }

code: sheet_comp_basic(t1, t2)

title: Stripped down version of sheet_comp — sheet_comp_basic
text: t1 First dataframe t2 Second dataframe, dimensions first.

title: Stripped down version of sheet_comp — sheet_comp_basic

what: Get column widths of openxlsx2 Workbook sheet — wb_get_col_widths
title: Get column widths of openxlsx2 Workbook sheet — wb_get_col_widths
text: Code Jan Marvin. function likely superceded function openxlsx2 future.

title: Get column widths of openxlsx2 Workbook sheet — wb_get_col_widths
code: wb_get_col_widths(wb, sheet = openxlsx2::current_sheet())

title: Get column widths of openxlsx2 Workbook sheet — wb_get_col_widths
text: wb openxlsx2 workbook object sheet sheet name, defaults current sheet

title: Get column widths of openxlsx2 Workbook sheet — wb_get_col_widths
text: Dataframe $col (column names) $width (column widths)

title: Get column widths of openxlsx2 Workbook sheet — wb_get_col_widths
code: library(openxlsx2) wb <- wb_workbook() |>   wb_add_worksheet("Sheet1") |>   wb_add_data(x = mtcars) |>   wb_set_col_widths(cols = 2:4, widths = 12)  current_widths <- wb_get_col_widths(wb, sheet = "Sheet1") current_widths #>     col  width #> 1     B 12.711 #> 1.1   C 12.711 #> 1.2   D 12.711

title: xldiff: Compare excel sheets — xldiff-package
text: `xldiff` provides tools compare excel sheets, broadly inspired "diff"-type functions. Provided functions can read sheets two excel files produce third file highlights cells changed. case numeric changes, direction change highlighted. tools account structural changes sheets (e.g., addition column), useful tracking changed values tables parameter files. Utility functions developed streamline formatting output files also broadly useful programmatically formatting excel files using openxlsx.

title: xldiff: Compare excel sheets — xldiff-package
text: Maintainer: Collin Edwards Collin.Edwards@dfw.wa.gov (ORCID)

title: xldiff 0.2.0
text: Updated excel_diff() use openslxs2 package. Sheets now automatically show original formatting (except highlighting) excel_diff() can now compare multiple sheets. sheet_name now takes multiple sheets compare. sheet names differ files, sheet_name_file_2 vector sheet names file 2, length sheet_name. excel_diff_tibble(): new function returns tibble instead table. Mostly wrapper present_rows_changed(), format equivalent excel_diff* functions. Updated sheet_comp() downstream functions (e.g., excel_diff(), excel_diff_table()) use arguments proportional_threshold optional argument absolute_threshold identify level changes ignore. Argument digits_show controls many significant digits shown presenting diffs. formula_status_diff() relabeled formula_diff(), identifies formulas changed (just .formula changed). Now invisibly returns dataframe changed cell addresses /formulas. Can compare multiple sheets function arguments (internal variables) use snake case, making consistent FRAMVERSE packages added internal input checking functions integrity.R. add_cell_borders() cell_stylize() remaining functions depend package openxlsx. functions now deprecated, package openxlsx now “Suggests” instead “Imports”. Unclear either deprecated functions useful home future – add anything , used parts TAMMsupport.
